page.title: 06Social Concerns. Bank Street
page.content: The distict council plan to allow property developers to build shops etc. in a part of the town which will close off one of the two entrances to the main car park.The inhabitants of the town are againts this as shown by a petition organised by the Chamber of Trade.In an interview with the chairman of the Chamber of Trade,he explained that they{do not object}to the shops being built as long as the traffic flowed smoothly,otherwise people might be discouraged from bringing cars into the town and so trade in the existing shops would suffer,he felt that the Chamber could influence decisions through discussion and would do all in their power to retain the characters of Chepstow.
